ingredients: Toppings: 1 tbsp chia seeds, sliced banana
steps_to_prepare: 1. Combine banana, Greek yogurt, frozen spinach, protein powder, and milk/water in a blender.
2. Blend until smooth and creamy. Add more liquid if needed to reach desired consistency.
3. Pour into a bowl.
4. Top with chia seeds and extra sliced banana.
tips_and_tricks: Use a frozen banana for a thicker, ice-cream-like texture. You can add a tablespoon of peanut butter for extra protein and flavor.

ingredients: Salt and black pepper to taste
steps_to_prepare: 1. In a large bowl, combine the rinsed chickpeas, diced cucumber, diced tomato, and diced bell pepper.
2. In a small bowl, whisk together the olive oil, lemon juice, dried oregano, salt, and pepper to create the dressing.
3. Pour the dressing over the chickpea and vegetable mixture.
4. Toss gently to combine. Serve immediately or chill for 10 minutes for flavors to meld.
tips_and_tricks: Add some crumbled paneer or feta cheese (if not strictly Jain) for extra flavor and protein. Fresh cilantro or parsley also works well.

meal_name: Quick Jain Palak Paneer with Basmati Rice
steps_to_prepare: 1. Rinse basmati rice until water runs clear. In a pot, add rice and 2 cups of water, bring to a boil, then cover and simmer on low for 15-20 minutes until water is absorbed.
2. While rice cooks, heat oil in a pan over medium heat. Add cumin seeds and let them splutter. Add asafoetida, grated ginger, and green chili. Sauté for 30 seconds.
3. Add the tomato puree, turmeric powder, and coriander powder. Cook for 5-7 minutes until the oil starts to separate.
4. Add the thawed spinach and salt. Mix well and cook for 5 minutes.
5. Gently stir in the paneer cubes and garam masala. Cook for another 2-3 minutes.
6. Serve hot with the cooked basmati rice.
tips_and_tricks: For a creamier texture, you can blend the spinach mixture before adding the paneer. Make a double batch for an easy lunch wrap the next day.

ingredients: Salt and black pepper to taste
steps_to_prepare: 1. Toast the slices of whole wheat bread to your desired crispness.
2. In a small bowl, mash the avocado with a fork. Mix in the lemon juice, salt, and pepper.
3. Spread the mashed avocado evenly on the toasted bread.
4. Sprinkle with chili flakes and serve immediately.
tips_and_tricks: A sprinkle of black salt (kala namak) can add a nice savory, slightly eggy flavor.

steps_to_prepare: 1. Gently reheat the leftover Palak Paneer in a pan or microwave.
2. Warm the whole wheat tortillas in a dry pan for 30 seconds per side or in the microwave for 15 seconds.
3. Place a line of the warm Palak Paneer down the center of each tortilla.
4. Top with shredded lettuce if desired.
5. Fold the sides of the tortilla in and roll it up tightly.
tips_and_tricks: Add a dollop of Greek yogurt or a sprinkle of cheese for extra creaminess.

ingredients: For Salsa: 1 tomato, 2 tbsp chopped cilantro, squeeze of lime juice, salt
steps_to_prepare: 1. Make the quick salsa: Finely dice the tomato and combine with chopped cilantro, a squeeze of lime juice, and a pinch of salt. Set aside.
2. In a bowl, mix the black beans, corn, and cumin powder.
3. Heat a large pan or griddle over medium heat with a little oil.
4. Place one tortilla in the pan. Sprinkle half of it with 1/4 of the cheese, then 1/4 of the bean/corn mixture, then another 1/4 of the cheese.
5. Fold the other half of the tortilla over the filling. Cook for 2-3 minutes per side, until golden brown and the cheese is melted.
6. Repeat for the second quesadilla. Cut into wedges and serve with the fresh salsa.
tips_and_tricks: You can add finely diced bell peppers to the filling for more veggies. Serve with a side of Greek yogurt or sour cream.

steps_to_prepare: 1. Use a fork to crumble the pressed tofu into a bowl. It should resemble scrambled eggs.
2. Stir in the nutritional yeast, turmeric powder, black salt, and black pepper.
3. Heat oil in a non-stick skillet over medium heat. Add the diced bell pepper and cook for 2-3 minutes until slightly softened.
4. Add the crumbled tofu mixture to the skillet.
5. Cook, stirring occasionally, for 5-7 minutes until the tofu is heated through. Serve hot.
tips_and_tricks: Serve with a side of avocado toast or in a whole wheat tortilla for a breakfast burrito.

ingredients: 1 cup leftover black bean and corn mixture
steps_to_prepare: 1. Place the chopped lettuce in a large bowl as the base.
2. Top with the leftover black bean and corn mixture.
3. Sprinkle the shredded cheese over the top.
4. Add the fresh salsa and sliced avocado.
5. Toss gently or serve as is. You can crush a tortilla chip on top for crunch.
tips_and_tricks: A dollop of Greek yogurt makes a great creamy dressing.

ingredients: 1/4 cup raw cashews, soaked in hot water for 15 mins
steps_to_prepare: 1. Cook the fettuccine according to package directions. Drain, reserving 1/2 cup of pasta water.
2. While pasta cooks, drain the soaked cashews. In a blender, combine the cashews, canned tomatoes (with juice), basil, and oregano. Blend until completely smooth.
3. Heat olive oil in a pan. Sauté the chopped bell peppers for 3-4 minutes until tender-crisp.
4. Pour the blended tomato-cashew sauce into the pan. Season with salt and pepper. Simmer for 5 minutes.
5. Add the cooked pasta to the sauce, tossing to coat. Add a splash of reserved pasta water if the sauce is too thick.
6. Serve immediately.
tips_and_tricks: For extra protein, stir in a can of rinsed chickpeas or some pan-fried tofu cubes.

steps_to_prepare: 1. Toast the bread to your liking.
2. Spread peanut butter evenly on each slice of toast.
3. Arrange banana slices on top of the peanut butter.
4. Sprinkle with chia seeds if using and serve.
tips_and_tricks: A drizzle of maple syrup can add a touch of sweetness.

steps_to_prepare: 1. Place leftover pasta in a microwave-safe bowl or in a small saucepan.
2. Add a tablespoon of water or milk to help loosen the sauce while reheating.
3. Reheat in the microwave for 2-3 minutes, stirring halfway through, or on the stovetop over medium-low heat until warmed through.
tips_and_tricks: Sprinkle with some fresh basil or a little extra cheese before serving.

ingredients: 1 cup mixed vegetables (cauliflower florets, peas, diced bell pepper)
1 tsp biryani masala or garam masala
steps_to_prepare: 1. Heat oil in a deep pot or pressure cooker over medium heat. Add cumin seeds, let them splutter.
2. Add asafoetida, ginger, and green chili. Sauté for 30 seconds.
3. Add the mixed vegetables and sauté for 3-4 minutes.
4. Add the turmeric powder, biryani masala, and salt. Stir well.
5. Add the rinsed basmati rice and stir gently to coat the rice with the spices.
6. Pour in the water and bring to a boil. If using a pot, reduce heat to low, cover, and cook for 15-20 minutes. If using a pressure cooker, cook for 1 whistle.
7. Let it rest for 5 minutes, then fluff with a fork. Garnish with cilantro and serve with a side of plain yogurt.
tips_and_tricks: A few strands of saffron soaked in warm milk can be added for color and aroma.
appliances_and_utensils: Deep pot with lid or Pressure cooker

ingredients: 1/2 cup canned mango pulp or fresh mango chunks
steps_to_prepare: 1. Combine yogurt, mango pulp/chunks, and milk in a blender.
2. Add sweetener if your mango is not sweet enough.
3. Blend until smooth and creamy.
4. Pour into a glass and serve immediately.
tips_and_tricks: Add a pinch of ground cardamom for a traditional flavor. A few ice cubes will make it colder and thicker.

steps_to_prepare: 1. To make the raita, combine yogurt, grated cucumber, cumin powder, and salt in a small bowl. Mix well.
2. Reheat the leftover biryani in a microwave or on the stovetop.
3. Serve the hot biryani with the cool cucumber raita on the side.
tips_and_tricks: You can also add finely chopped tomatoes or cilantro to your raita.

ingredients: 1 cup shredded or fresh mozzarella cheese
steps_to_prepare: 1. Preheat your oven to 425°F (220°C).
2. In a small bowl, mix the tomato puree with dried oregano, dried basil, and salt to make the sauce.
3. Place the pizza base on a baking sheet. Spread the sauce evenly over the base, leaving a small border.
4. Sprinkle the mozzarella cheese over the sauce.
5. Bake for 10-12 minutes, or until the crust is golden and the cheese is bubbly and melted.
6. Remove from the oven, top with fresh basil leaves, drizzle with olive oil, slice, and serve.
tips_and_tricks: For extra flavor, add sliced tomatoes or bell peppers as toppings before baking.

steps_to_prepare: 1. Lightly toast the bread slices if desired.
2. Drizzle one side of each bread slice with olive oil.
3. Layer the slices of tomato, fresh mozzarella, and fresh basil leaves on one slice of bread.
4. Season with salt and pepper.
5. Top with the other slice of bread. Press gently and serve.
tips_and_tricks: You can make this into a grilled cheese by buttering the outside of the bread and cooking in a pan until golden and the cheese is melted.

ingredients: For Tadka: 2 tbsp ghee or oil
steps_to_prepare: 1. In a pot, combine the rinsed red lentils, water, turmeric powder, and salt. Bring to a boil.
2. Reduce heat, cover partially, and simmer for 15-20 minutes until the lentils are soft and cooked through.
3. While the dal cooks, prepare the tadka (tempering). Heat ghee or oil in a small pan.
4. Add cumin seeds and let them sizzle. Add the dried red chili, asafoetida, and grated ginger. Sauté for 30 seconds until fragrant.
5. Pour the hot tadka over the cooked dal and stir immediately. Be careful as it will splutter.
6. Serve hot with basmati rice.
tips_and_tricks: A squeeze of lemon juice at the end brightens up the flavor of the dal.

ingredients: Lettuce and tomato slices for serving
steps_to_prepare: 1. Boil the raw banana until tender (about 15-20 minutes). Peel and mash it in a large bowl.
2. Add the rinsed chickpeas to the bowl and mash them coarsely with the banana.
3. Stir in the quick oats, cumin powder, coriander powder, garam masala, minced green chili, cilantro, and salt. Mix until well combined.
4. Divide the mixture into 4 equal portions and shape them into patties.
5. Heat oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Cook the patties for 5-6 minutes on each side, until golden brown and cooked through.
6. During the last minute of cooking, place a slice of cheese on top of each patty to melt.
7. Lightly toast the burger buns.
8. Assemble the burgers with the cooked patty, lettuce, and tomato slices. Serve immediately.
tips_and_tricks: If the mixture is too wet, add more oats. If it's too dry, add a tablespoon of water. These patties can be made ahead and refrigerated.
